data.title: University of Michigan Athletics
data.meta_description: Kyle Dernedde (5) INF - Graduate (2024) • Started all 60 games at shortstop • Hit .251 over the course of the season with 31 runs and 29 RBIs • Had 11 multi-...
data.text:
Graduate (2024)

• Started all 60 games at shortstop

• Hit .251 over the course of the season with 31 runs and 29 RBIs

• Had 11 multi-hit games and seven multi-RBI games

• Turned 43 double plays during the season with 111 putouts and 194 assists

• Tallied a two run-double against Penn State (May 25)

• Recorded two-run home run against Indiana (May 17)

• Had a three-run home run and scored again in 14-4 win over Akron (May 14)

• Homered in 8-6 win over Purdue (May 12)

• Went 3-for-4 with run and RBI in 9-5 win over Central Michigan (May 8)

• Brought home three runs on two hits and sacrifice fly in 4-0 win over Ohio State (Apr. 19)

• Recorded one hit and two RBIs in three at-bats against Penn State (Mar.24)

• Recorded two hits in three at-bats against San Diego (Mar. 16).

• Knocked in three RBIs on two hits with a run scored in a 7-6 win over Toledo (Mar. 12)

• Had two hits, one run, and one RBI against No. 18 Coastal Carolina (Mar. 9)

• Went 3-for-5 with two runs in a 13-5 win over Oakland (Mar. 6)

• Recorded two hits and one run against UC Irvine (Mar. 2)

• Had one hit and scored two runs against Western Michigan (Feb. 17)

• Made Michigan debut with two hits against Western Michigan (Feb. 16)

Prior to Michigan

• Played four seasons at Oregon State

Senior (2023)

• Played in 52 games, starting 49. Batted .248 with seven doubles, four home runs, 26 RBI and 27 walks. Collected nine multiple-hit efforts and seven multi-RBI games

• Hit a grand slam and doubled in a 2-for-5 night against Western Carolina, driving in two (5/19)

• Scored a career-high four runs and finished 2-for-4 with two walks in the finale at UCLA (5/14)

• Equaled a career-high with four hits, including a home run, in game two at UCLA (5/13)

• Recorded his fifth mult-hit game of the season, going 2-for-5 with a run in the finale versus Utah (5/7)

• Pushed his hit streak to seven games with a 2-for-3 day in the finale at Arizona State, walking twice (4/23)

• Hit a three-run home run in the sixth in the opener versus Coppin State (2/24)

• Homered in the win over UC Santa Barbara (2/20)

• Went 1-for-4 with two RBI against New Mexico (2/19)

• Drove in a pair and went 1-for-4 in the win over Minnesota (2/18)

Junior (2022)

• Corvallis Regional All-Tournament Team

• Played in 60 games, making 58 starts. Batted .216 with six doubles, one triple, one home run and 15 RBI. Stole five bases

• Had three hits, driving in three in the Corvallis Regional finale versus Vanderbilt (6/6)

• Doubled and drove in a run in a 2-for-4 night versus San Diego (6/4)

• Went 2-for-3 with a double and three runs scored vs. Oregon (5/7)

• Tied a season-best with three hits and drove in a run in the finale at California (3/27)

• Set a career-best with three hits and three runs vs. Grand Canyon (3/16)

• Hit his first career home run and finished 2-for-4 with two runs, two RBI and a triple against Xavier (2/25)

• Was 2-for-5 with three runs and an RBI in the opener against New Mexico (2/18)

Sophomore (2021)

• Fort-Worth All-Regional Team

• Played in 16 games, starting nine. Batted .290 with four doubles, nine RBI and 10 walks

• Tied an OSU postseason single-game record with six RBI in a 2-for-3 effort versus McNeese, doubling twice (6/5)

• Went 2-for-3, scoring three runs, with two walks in the series finale at Stanford (5/29)

• Hit his first career double in a 1-for-2 day in the finale at Washington (3/29)

• Singled for his first career hit in the win over New Mexico (2/20)

Freshman (2020)

• Did not play

Prep

• Competed for the Royals team at the 2018 Area Code Games

• Four-time First-Team All-League selection

• Tualatin High School’s career leader in hits (124), RBI (72), doubles (31), triples (8), walks (54) and runs scored (92)

• Earned All-League and All-State honors in Senior year

• Batted .440 with 10 doubles, eight triples, two home runs and 31 RBI as a senior

• As a junior, named First-Team All-League and Second-Team All-State

• Batted .365 with five doubles, two triples, two home runs and 16 RBI in junior year

• Earned honorable mention All-State as a sophomore, and was First-Team All-League

• First-Team All-League selection as a freshman in 2016

• Batted .375 with 10 doubles, one triple and 24 RBI his first season at Tualatin

• Lettered three seasons in football. 2018 Second-Team All-League selection at quarterback and kicker and honorable mention at punter

Personal

• Kyle Robert Von Dernedde

• Born November 8, 2000

• Son of Mary and Mary Dernedde

• Father, Mark, competed on the track team at Willamette and Oregon State University

• Enrolled in the Rackham Graduate School pursuing a graduate certificate in Real Estate Development
